intro: Melodorum clementis, commonly known as the Clementine Melodorum, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Melodorum, characterized by its fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pale pink. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
